user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_TaskSetPriority_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_TaskSetPriority_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, osal_priority_t new_priority)
{
    int os_priority;
    int ret;

    OS_impl_task_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_task_table, *token);

    if (POSIX_GlobalVars.EnableTaskPriorities)
    {
        /* Change OSAL priority into a priority that will work for this OS */
        os_priority = OS_PriorityRemap(new_priority);

        /*
        ** Set priority
        */
        ret = pthread_setschedprio(impl->id, os_priority);
        if (ret != 0)
        {
            OS_DEBUG("pthread_setschedprio: Task ID = %lu, prio = %d, err = %s\n",
                     OS_ObjectIdToInteger(OS_ObjectIdFromToken(token)), os_priority, strerror(ret));
            return OS_ERROR;
        }
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_TaskSetPriority_Impl:
extern POSIX_GlobalVars_t POSIX_GlobalVars
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_impl_task_internal_record_t OS_impl_task_table[OS_MAX_TASKS]
...
typedef struct
{
    pthread_t id;
} OS_impl_task_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
static int OS_PriorityRemap(osal_priority_t InputPri)
{
    int OutputPri;

    if (InputPri == 0)
    {
        /* use the "MAX" local priority only for OSAL tasks with priority=0 */
        OutputPri = POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMax;
    }
    else if (InputPri >= OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY)
    {
        /* use the "MIN" local priority only for OSAL tasks with priority=255 */
        OutputPri = POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMin;
    }
    else
    {
        /*
         * Spread the remainder of OSAL priorities over the remainder of local priorities
         *
         * Note OSAL priorities use the VxWorks style with zero being the
         * highest and OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY being the lowest, this inverts it
         */
        OutputPri = (OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY - 1) - (int)InputPri;

        OutputPri *= (POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMax - POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMin) - 2;
        OutputPri += OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY / 2;
        OutputPri /= (OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY - 2);
        OutputPri += POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMin + 1;
    }

    return OutputPri;
}
...
#define OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
static inline osal_id_t OS_ObjectIdFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_id;
}
...
static inline unsigned long OS_ObjectIdToInteger(osal_id_t object_id)
{
#ifdef OSAL_OMIT_DEPRECATED
    return object_id.v;
#else
    return object_id;
#endif
}
...
#define OS_ERROR (-1)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
OS_DEBUG("pthread_setschedprio: Task ID = %lu, prio = %d, err = %s\n",
                     OS_ObjectIdToInteger(OS_ObjectIdFromToken(token)), os_priority, strerror(ret));
explanation:
I selected fragments that are potentially removed or made unreachable by preprocessing or by compile-time configuration: the entire EnableTaskPriorities conditional block (including the debug call), the OS_DEBUG invocation itself, the empty OS_DEBUG macro definition, and the OS_ObjectIdToInteger function with its #ifdef/#else branches. These should be investigated because the debug invocation is eliminated by the empty macro and the conditional compilation in OS_ObjectIdToInteger can make one branch never compiled.

Other fragments were not selected because they are not evidently unreachable at compile time: variable declarations, the call to OS_PriorityRemap, the call to pthread_setschedprio, the OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET usage, and the final return OS_SUCCESS are all reachable depending on runtime state (POSIX_GlobalVars.EnableTaskPriorities, return value of pthread_setschedprio, and token contents). The macro definitions for OS_ERROR and OS_SUCCESS are simple constants and not themselves unreachable code; likewise the OS_PriorityRemap implementation contains runtime-conditional branches that are not provably constant/unreachable from the shown code. Therefore these were not included as suspicious for MISRA Rule 2.1 investigation.
